reviewText:
Metro Last Light is the long anticipated sequel to Metro 2033, one of the truly great post apocalyptic games. Last Light takes off where 2033 ended, throwing you, Artyom head first into the action. You are enlisted under The Order (Polis Rangers), an elite army of rangers dedicated to keeping peace within the metro. However, after learning of the Spartans discoverey of D6, the reds want a piece of the cake and they will get it by any means necessary.


You've been visited by an old friend, Khan, informing you of one last surviving 'Dark One', an infamous race of deformed creatures that nearly wiped out Artyom's home station Exhibition, but were unsuccessful when Artyom fired hell missiles upon the Dark One's home. The Orders commander, Miller, orders elite sniper Anna and yourself to hunt the once thriving community of Botanical Gardens, now the ruins of the Dark One's home, to destroy the last surviving Dark One.

Through your travels deep within the Metro and on the surface you meet friends, bandits, opposing forces and new mutants. You are given a wider array of weapons, all of which have the ability to be modded, adding laser sights, silencers, extended magazines among additional useful tools. You have the choice to act alone using stealth, sticking to the shadows picking off targets one by one, careful not to be seen, or as a one man powerhouse, shooting your way through the Metro, crushing all who stand in your way to Polis station.

Last Light keeps what we loved about 2033, the atmosphere. As you make your way through the dead, barren wastes of post apocalyptic Moscow you're unsure of what hides behind the next corner, what danger lies within what's left of the dead cities structures. You are standing among the fallen, shadowy outlines of what used to be, cries of children ringing in your ears. Gunshots in the distance, crackles and rustling behind you. Safety and warmth only provided by the friendly stations deep underground within the Metro.

Your fate is ultimately decided the way you progress the game. Do you show mercy to those who oppose you, do you destroy anything or anyone that threatens you. Do you help the homeless and assist civilians against bandits. It's all down to you.


Metro Last Light is certainly worth a look if you like first person shooters, apocalyptic, adventure and creepy games. It provides a strong story line directly connected to 2033, a wonderful atmosphere to experience, smooth controls, stunning visual graphics and sounds.

reviewText:
I've bought this game in a bundle with Metro: 2033 last week in the steam sale, immediately I fell in love with the game as I played it for ~1-2 hours.
This games atmosphere is by far the best i've encountered in a long time, not to mention the excellent sound design combined with the revamped graphics.
The story is great and the game in my opinion has perfect voice acting.

(Both pros and cons in this review apply to Metro: 2033 as well.)
Pros :
- Fairly challenging, depending on how you play.
- Good replay value thanks to the different playstyles and difficulties.
- Interesting story, that will keep you motivated During the game.
- Great voice acting and sound design.
- Impressive visuals.
- Really good looking animations.
- Awesome Atmosphere.
- Memorable characters.

Cons :
- Linear Gameplay (not that big of a deal, but it's noticable).
- Mediocore Gunplay/Movement Mechanics.
- Somewhat easy in Normal Mode" - "Spartan" Playstyle
recommended: i recommend "Hardcore/Ranger Mode" - "Survival" Playstyle.\n- The game is SHORT
hoursPlayed: only 7-8 hours of gameplay (2033 is a little shorter) if you don't count the extra DLC content that comes whit the bundle
voteText: it can be a little bit longer if you do some side activities (Collect notes
helpfulPercent: etc...).\n\nOverall i think that both games are great and definitely worth buying
votesHelpful: but 20€ for a story this long seems a little bit too much
votesTotal: i recommend buying the bundle in a steam sale
votesFunny: like i did
commentsCount: its just 6
column16: 99€ and you get both games+All the DLC."

reviewText: Metro series is just amazing! The story is interesting and the eviroment is cool. Achiements are pretty easy to get if you know what you are doing. For me the both of the remade (redux) games were a look back into one of my favourite games. New graphics and the new ai made this very enjoyalbe when in the original games some glitches made it little bit weird. If you are playing this game before metro 2033 just dont. The story will make little more sense and you really know something about the game before you jump into it. Metro 2033 had a better tutorial than last light and the things Artyoum does make more sense. For this game i would give 10/10

reviewText:
If you're looking for a game that really shines on PC, look elsewhere, this isn't it.

The settings menu is very VERY lacking

There's no option in game to change the ridiculously low FoV (Which is especially important to those who suffer with motion sickness), though luckily this can be changed with an .ini tweak.

V-Sync outright does not work, it should be called '60 FPS cap'

I don't think Windowed/Borderless windowed are even options in game either.

The mouse sensitivity is genuinely stupid. you can't adjust vertical/horizontal separately and its locked by the game so that you can't change this. For some reason.

No AA outside of 'SSAA' Which at 0.5 is literally upscaling a half resolution image and looks horrendous (though will give better performance, which is actually nice) Or 2x+ which means you're rendering at double resolution and scaling down. There is FXAA, but it's tied to the 'Quality' Setting, because we're too stupid to make our own choices and have advanced options settings right?

There's probably some other stuff I'm forgetting.

As for the game itself, well I'm only a bit in, so I'll update this if/when I beat it, but so far.

- Voice Acting is not great. I'm personally not so bothered about this and I still noticed it, so I recommend checking out a video of the game and going from there. Or you could just set it to Russian voice w/ subtitles if you want.

- Graphics - They're solid. I remember hearing how good they were back when the original Last Light came out, so either they haven't aged well, or the port's crushed them. I don't know. Don't get me wrong, they're still very playable, and from what I've played the indoor metro sequences look good, its just the outside stuff that suffers, imo. But again I've not seen that much to be fair.

To be honest I've probably been spoiled by new games when it comes to graphics.

Also the most bizzarely distracting thing, lights attached to people's heads update at a really low speed. I don't know if framerate's the right word, but it's like they're only re-drawing them at 30fps. It's noticeable and kind of takes away from the immersion - really not a fan of this. I guess it was to reduce load on GPUs but I'm playing on Ultra for a reason, or they could just add a setting like a normal developer.

-Not going to comment on story, haven't played enough.

-Shooting. It feels impactful enough, nothing special. I do like the fact that they've tried to do a stealth system though, it seems to be decently robust, I may well change my opinion on this later though.

Just on the basis of how annoyingly lazy and barebones this PC Port feels, I'll give it a cautious 'Do Not Recommend' for now. If I get through the game for its issues and feel it was worth it, I'll change this.

If you really enjoyed the story of 2033, and go in knowing you may run into technical issues, then that's a different story.

reviewText: After hearing about this game form friends and may other gamers singing its praises when this game came on sell I brought it straight away . I didnt look up anything of the game to try and get a blind test but i new it was a survival game with story driven aspects, after playing games like fallout and stalker I had  high hopes. well i was very very wrong. The first problem i had was running the game, I have a GTX 970, i5 process with 16gb  of ram so expecting at least 60fp at max settings expecially with this being an older title. No i got 40fps and thats not even on max settings. Would be forgiven if the game looked nice with graphical pleasing  scenery what it doesn't, there are some nice cinimatic shots of the waste land but not enough to make me expect that frame rate. The A.I. is brain dead with them either avoiding you for no reason or hitting you once to then run off to hit your A.I. buddy who then misses so then then runs off, Makes the game play look real cool with all the missing adn running around, looks like old people tring to break dance. The shooting is not satsifing and seems more like a grind then for any kind of fun. But when your not shooting you will be walking talking about something that you have no idea about or care for. Non of the characters are at all interesting and are the generic russian stereotypes. They kill off characters and im left think who  was that or just like there goes another one. I will say the guns are very interesting with some cool ideas and lots of customization like fire bullets and a tone of attachments. The use of bullets as both ammo and a curency is an unqiue idea that matches with the theme well, can lead to important decision like should I save up for a gun or uses them in the next mission. However with little variety of missions means that they can get boring fast and with most of the game being you geuesed I a metro can leave the enviroments looking bland and unoriginal.\nOverall I find this game frustrating and boring with little to satisfy my gaming needs. With no story and simple game play that leaves a lot to be desired I would not recommend this game.\n

reviewText:
The adrenaline rush you get when you realise you have no ammo for the next boss, your gasmask is cracked and seaping poisonous air into your lungs and you have no health packs or filters left... There is no other choice but to man up and fight the boss thrice your size with throwing knives and courage. This is Metro.

Metro: Last Light is a very immersive, superb linear first-person shooter that has good stealth elements mixed in the sauce. The AI is pretty stupid though, and even one step you take without crouching makes them question the sound even though they have a dozen friends running around already. Another thing that really annoys me is changing between your throwable weapons, you have to move your mouse while in-game in a very idiotic way that I really cannot even describe.

The Redux version of Last Light does not differ from the original at all, if you don't count some fixed lighting. The graphics are fantastic. Play in Hardcore Ranger-mode for a good time! 9/10

reviewText:
A Paladin's Review: Metro Last Light Redux. An Interesting Sequel But With More Than One Boob To Be Found.Genre: First Person Linear Shooter with Horror and Stealth Mechanics.
Developed and Published by: 4A Games and Deep Silver.
Platform: Windows, Mac, Linux and Consoles.
Business Model: Base Game.
Redux Edition purchased by myselfRead the full and unabridged review on A Paladin Without A Crusade[wp.me]

If you’re wondering why I’m reviewing this game with a scant couple of hours on Steam's record, most of the playtime went into the original Metro: Last Light edition with over 12 hours worth of playtime sunk into it. As I feel the differences between the original and Redux are pretty negligible, I’m confident that my opinion fits for both editions. This was going to be a double review for both editions but the original edition of Last Light was pulled from Steam recently so I decided to combine it into one review.

The Bugs and Stability Situation
The game comes off as an overpriced Game-of-the-Year edition with a patch to fix some, but not all, of the problems the original game had. Really, it’s kind of insulting how many bugs and glitches survived to this re-release of Last Light. For myself, I ran into a game-crashing bug during the walk with Khan in the level “Quarantine”. I was heading over to the gun merchant when the game suddenly freezes and crashes. There wasn't any indication of what caused it. The only way to get around it was to load the chapter itself, not the auto-save. There was also animation, texture oddities and mutant attack issues that you could notice from time to time. I would also notice characters speaking over each other. There are also numerous reports on the Steam forums of bugs and crashes so this is definitely a touchy game.

PC Settings and Optimization
Optimization wise, the game is about the same as Metro 2033 Redux. Which isn't all that surprising considering they’re on the same engine. Its pretty good for me, but there are plenty of reports to the contrary. There is yet another graphics quality slider but thankfully we can change a few more settings such as V-sync, Tessellation, SSAA and Texture Filtering now. Field-of-view has to be changed in a user.cfg file. You can look up the instructions here on PCGamingWiki.[pcgamingwiki.com] It’s a few steps forward but more fine-tuned control would have been appreciated.

The Stealth System
The stealth system. It basically boils down to: stay in the shadows, don’t run and use silenced weapons/takedowns. Unless you really screw up or get impatient, the AI will never pick up that you were/are there. Even if you are standing five inches away from their face. The stealth system is two-dimensional and about as deep as a puddle. It is slightly better balanced than the Redux edition of Metro 2033 but I think that’s because the entire game was made with this stealth system in mind rather than tacked on later.

Combat Systems
Combat system isn’t quite as bad as Metro 2033 Redux’s but it isn’t that much better. A lot of enemies are bullet sponges and there are a lot of them. I don’t like the Ranger-setting restricting you to two weapons only but that’s a personal preference. Considering there are a lot of interesting weapons in the game, you really don’t get a lot of chance to hold and keep them as you’ll need silenced weapons on some levels and then fully-automatic weapons at other levels. Secondary weapons like knives are still handled poorly with the “press shift then move your mouse in the direction of the weapon you want” design. Far too many times, I would select what I thought were anti-personnel mines only to press the secondary weapon button and throw a knife. Cute. Keys 6-9 still exist Metro devs and they work wonders over your current implementation. Hitboxes still feel wonky but it’s hard to place why.

Overall Gameplay Thoughts
The journey itself through the Metro is still very immersive. The game is focused on presenting and enveloping you in the atmosphere of the Russian Metro in a post-apocalyptic future. Which, they pull of to a fantastic degree. I really have to give them kudos on this part because this was what kept me going through the game. Everything from wiping the swamp water or blood off your gas mask to the howling winds on the surface to the slowed progress you make through thick spiderwebs (that can be burned with your lighter). There’s a lot of world detail in this game and this part simply oozes polish. Even the recharging of certain weapons and your power for the flashlight and/or night vision, which would normally seem pointless otherwise, fits so well in this type of game. Credit given where it’s due, this game executes the world’s atmosphere excellently.

Final Thoughts
But, I can’t recommend Metro: Last Light Redux for new or returning players. Additionally, if you already have the original edition of Last Light, play it instead. Otherwise, you’re basically paying for an overpriced patch. To be frank, I feel cheated for having bought the Redux editions when compared to the original editions that I own. After all, it seems like they didn’t even take the time to make sure all of the bugs and glitches of the original were fixed. Worse still, is that the Mac and Linux versions haven’t been released yet. Granted, we’re still within the stated release date of “later this year” but we’re getting into November now. Time is running out. *Final Update* Both Linux and Mac versions were released earlier this year. Far behind schedule I think. I haven't heard anything about either versions.

Read the full and unabridged review on A Paladin Without A Crusade[kingisaaclinksr.com]

reviewText:
Great game until the crashes start to happen, crash to desktop, no errors, no logs, and very little support.

The issue was the game saved a corrupt save game, so when you reached this point again it would just crash (ie you died and respawned then got to this point in the level again), no warning, no error, only way I found to fix this was to obtain a set of completed saved games which allowed me to replay the levels. It may also be possible to just delete the saved game to restart a level, but I haven't tried this.
Very little support or advice on errors, I had to work this fix out for myself.

reviewText:
This is a Resident Evil/Call of Duty cross with just a nod to Metro 2033.  If you played Last Light there's nothing new in the Redux.  If you a fan of the original Metro 2033, not the Last Light wannabe that Metro 2033 Redux was, you won't enjoy this one.  Everything that was great in the original is lost here.  This game is just a mindless shooter like the resident Evil and Call of Duty games.  As matter of fact this game actually has Boss battles like Resident Evil.  What do creature Boss battles have to do with Metro games?

This is a heavily scripted game with a convoluted story that only serves to get you to the next round of shooting.  The AI is amazingly dumb and can't see you even if they are in front of you.  It seemed to me that the mutants were harder to kill only because the weapons damage was inconsistent.  In Metro 2033 you could rely on your weapons because the damage they doled out was consistent.  In Last Light Redux it seems to be arbitrary.  Even the sniper rifles were inconsistent in their damage; usually one shot to the head with a sniper rifle is an instant kill in in most games but not in this one.  Even the pneumatic weapons like the Tihar that were so deadly in Metro 2033, so much so that you could kill the Librarians easily with them, are hit and miss in this game.  Sometimes one shot to the head will do it and sometime you have to just keep blasting away.

I never found Metro 2033 to be too linear of a game even though you were in tunnels going from tunnel to another.  The same can't be said for Metro Last Light Redux it feels very linear.  You simply shoot your way from point A to point B.  Like the Boss battles in Resident Evil you just need to figure out what the key is.  In one laughable Boss battle the oversized mutant needed to knock down columns in order to bring down the ceiling so it was just a matter of running around in circles and letting the mutant knock them down, thereby saving my ammo.

There were too many of these scripted click a button and fend off the mutants until whatever is supposed to happen finally happens.  In those scenarios I found that I could save ammo by just running around in circles, like a fool, shooting the odd Nosalis that got in my way while waiting for the event to finish, i.e. the boat arrives for you to jump on to make your escape.  It’s basically one obviously scripted scene after another.

Also way too many cut scenes, a significant amount of the game is made up of cut scenes that you can't skip.  Most of this is story exposition, because the story was convoluted and very artificial.  Metro 2033, being based on the novel, had a very simple, straightforward plot and it was good at story telling.  However, even though the same author wrote the story line for Last Light, it really had the feeling of being a slapped together plot to justify the Metro Last Light sequel.

Bottom line if your Metro 2033 fans you will be disappointed in Last Light.  But if you’re a Resident Evil / Call of Duty fan there are plenty of mutants (just not the weird Resident Evil kind) and soldiers to shoot at.  So if you're just looking for a linear FPS shooter with fantastic graphics, and don't really care about the plot then you won't be disappointed in this game.

reviewText:
I sadly cannot recommend this game.
Does it have impressive graphics? Yes! Does it have solid gunplay? Yes. But that is bascially it. I really liked the first game but this is just more of the same and some additional bad stuff.

Note: I only played this game on the hardest difficulty level on Ranger mode. That means less supply, no HUD, so basically more immersive. BUT: While the game teaches you the basic controls (which should not be new to you, if you ever played an FPS) it doesn't explain controls that are specific for this game. If I hadn't played the first game I would had no idea that you can keep the flashlight button pressed to get out the dynamo to charge your batteries. And I skipped a lot of weapons until I found out that I had to keep the use button pressed to pick up a weapon. And later in a car I had to press every button to find the one that starts the engine. One may argue that it improves the immersion of the ranger mode but if have to open the control options several times to find all the buttons, this is stupid. And there are also hand symbols on your screen when you can open a door so that breaks the immersion as well, if you argue like that.

Also: For a game (world) where resources are apparently rare, you find way too much of them. So many times I couldn't pick up ammunition (even for my main guns), gas filters or medicine and this just feels stupid if you see yourself as a scavenger in a postapocalyptic world. And later in the game resources are suddenly very rare and it's then even more stupid that you can carry a lot of ammunition that you will never use (because you have a seperate ammunition slot and limit for each type of ammunition but you can only carry 2 guns at the same time) but not a single additional gas filter later on. Some sort of inventory management would have been better here I feel. I also got stuck later in the game without gas filters (sorry for looking around too much...) and no medicine (because it all of a sudden became very rare) and I really lost the will to keep playing the game. It's not that the game was too hard. I could have avoided that situation. But together with the bad boss design (more below) and the not that interesting story, I felt no urge to restart the chapter and try to make it better.

For a game that is called Metro, you also play too much outside later in the game. While interesting at first, it just get tedious with the need to frequently change your gas filters every 3 minutes or so (what kind of filters are that?). The outdoor sections are just annoying and you often don't know where to go because it's not apparent where you can go or jump over or where you'll find invisible walls. You have a clipboard with sort of a compass that shows you the right direction and you'll need that very, very often. But you can't really see the compass if you use your night vision goggles that you also often want to use in the dark sections of the game... The good parts of the game are the close quarter or underground sections but these also feel exactly like playing Metro 2033.

There is also a Karma system that determines the ending of the game (like in the first game) but for me, the system makes no sense. Why does listening to a boring story increases your Karma (or whatever)? And there was a situation where I had to decide to let someone die or rescue him, but I had no idea how to rescue him (again no button prompts or so in Ranger mode), so he died although I wanted to help him... So be prepared to watch the good" ending on YouTube after finishing the game.

Another large problem I have with this game is the boss design. These are just large creatures that take a lot of bullets to kill. But this game is not made for this. It has good
date: realistic gun play but no real dodge or cover mechanic so you just run around the enemy in circles and shoot at him until it's dead... Wow... I mean that is some way to deplete your resources and find a reason to pick up new ones.\n\nThe fight against human enemies or the normal creatures on the other hand is fun. In Ranger mode
recommended: enemies die from a headshot but you die very fast as well. I found that very rewarding. But this comes with another problem: The sneaking. You can avoid a lot of the fights by just staying in the dark
hoursPlayed: killing enemies silently or sneak around them. But the reaction of the enemies to your sneaking is very
voteText: very basic. They either don't see you at all
helpfulPercent: see you for a short time
votesHelpful:
but think it was probably nothing after shortly searching for you or instantly see you if you are not in the dark. They also seem to ignore their friends that die next to them from a throwing knife (that for some reason instantly kills an unaware enemy but not an aware enemy). You are basically invisible or visible for everyone. These are not solid stealth mechanics for me. I prefer the shooting anyway but on the hardest difficulty you normally have to sneak or at least kill some enemies before you get detected.


Conclusion:
This game has a lot of potential but doesn't use it correctly. Play Metro 2033

reviewText: A great and engaging experience up until Chapter 8, when I inexplicably ran out of air filters despite having picked up 3-4 of them early on. The game auto-saved right after I lost my last filter, which was brilliant. The constant focus on having to replace filters when fighting outside is excruciating. Of all the action FPSes that could benefit from a quicksave feature, this is the one. Instead, we're stuck having to constantly replay long stretches, which is as fun as visiting the dentist and not getting free nitrous oxide.

reviewText:
Game looks great, and its pretty good the first third of the game. A bit to much handholding and following NPC around but aside from that the beginning is alot of fun, and great looking. Then about one third in maby the last half of the game its just garbage.

Graphics are still decent, but alot of high contrast effects etc that just hurts my eyes and look terrible. Combat becomes just a run and gun where you run around trying to figure out what your suppose to do while monsters keep spawning. Bosses that are just bullet soakers where you waste all your ammo just to progress to the next area. You can not sneak past them like other parts of the game.

Then you end up in frustrating parts where you ride trains and shoot at opposing trains, here you die if you dont kill the enemys fast enough, cover does not matter you just instantly die after about 3-4 sec. Other areas you are placed in a yard with tall buildings where enemys spawn and shoot down at you from all sides. All you get is some wood cover that they shoot thru, these areas and others you will have to just repeat untill you make it or find an exploit (was playing ranger mode).

I played the game with russian speach and english subtitles, and dialoge was pretty good most of the time, but that to just got worse and at the end i didnt even bother with the dialog, it was painfull. Russian sounds cool tho, i recomend it. The english speach is even worse.

To summerise, combat is fun in the first part of the game, sound is not great and the dialoge story is nothing to praise really. It mostly comes down to the atmosphere and graphics in the first 3 hours of the game maby. Then everything is just a pain. I would not recomend this game for anything less then 9 euro, maby even less. Might be worth it to just play the first bit of the game again.

reviewText:
Well. It's not bad. not bad  at all, it's beautiful graphically and the gameplay is spot on to the original Metro game. but there is a few things that really made me decide against this game. but sadly, I cannot give it a thumbs up and here's why!

First of all, the check point system is absolute garbage, rather than letting you save your own game, it autosaves and places checkpoints  at certain times, so if you ever die, you will end up back at that point. However, this checkpoint system backfires too often, because if it checkpoints only mere moments from your death, you'll just be stuck in a cycle that will require you to go back even further into your saves in order to undo that checkpoint and stop it from completely destroying your progress.

The story didn't feel as good as 2033. while I know the metro series was based off of the books, the first game was completely fine and I loved the story. in this game, I actually struggle to care for any of the characters, they are not interesting in the slightest, the story does have its moments, I'll give it that.

The most ♥♥♥♥♥♥ love interest ever in any game I've ever played. Seriously. I don't feel any build up between the player and Anna, yet they play her off as a lousy love interest , who you have ONE scene with her and it's a  we're ****ed
date: might as  well bang!" set up too. It was super weak and I don't see the point of the scene even existing. or Anna existing for that manner.\n\nI had high hopes for this game. I really  did
recommended: but the setbacks bother me too much to give it a good score."

reviewText:
Do not buy this game, Last level is bugged.

-Minor Spoilers-
After 15 hours or so of playing this game I got to the final level: D6.
I died after the boss battle (tank).

It seems this is a known bug that if you die after the boss fight the game crash to desktop,
and even after you load the game again it immediately crashes to desktop.

To only way around it is to Load a chapter, so I did. I loaded the D6 chapter.

The chapter started in place that looked nothing like the level I played,
Nothing like the walk through on the internet, none of my gear was present,
and I am sure all of my morality choices were erased as well.

The game have only a checkpoint system with only one checkpoint at a time.
So if you are stuck (like I was) you need to load a chapter or start over which erase all your progress
making the game going into default generic state.

The game have a horrible FOV as well.

other than that it's ok, but I think it dose not worth the money.
If you can find it in 5$ go ahead, other than that, NO!

reviewText:
Purchase Metro Last Light on Sale:

While the 'redux' part of Last Light does little, the game itself is solid; up until its lackluster final third. The story almost forgets about itself for most of the experience, essentially with you trying to get back on track for most of the game. It makes for interesting world building when you explore the genuinly creepy environments, but at the cost of the main-through-line narrative seeming like an afterthought. The last third ubruptly changes (thematically) to more overt 'morality'  based stuff and it just comes of as Po-faced.

Metro 2033 is superior and with it's own redux version, the improvements to gameplay seen in Last Light are used to bolster up the narrativly superior 2033 <-- go buy that one instead.

reviewText:
Metro 2033 was much better than this game.

Pros:

- Cool setting and detailed environments
- Some cool parts, especially the first few hours of gameplay

Cons:

- Only about 10 hours of gameplay if you're experienced at FPS games
- REALLY buggy.  Crashes on startup after playing for a few hours, you have to go in and delete your config file and put all your settings back manually to continue.
- Mac port is garbage.  You literally can't change the resolution.  Even editing the config file itself doesn't work.
- Story is largely forgettable
- Ending(s) are really unrewarding
- Most of the game is a Call of Duty clone. i.e. walk 30 seconds / kill bad guys to trigger next scripted sequence of events)

reviewText:
Stunning Visuals - Poor Game
While Metro: Last Light is certainly a visual and audio marvel at it's own right, there is little to  be said about everything the rest of the game.  The story line is very linear and your choices don't really play out in the end. The game mechanics can be easily cheated (like using air filters), and you hardly take any damage, while pretty much every gun can headshot kill anything.  The AI aren't the smartest, and the bosses aren't even challenging (especially when the game's characters tell you their weakspots).  The game is overly sexual in content, and there isn't a need for it.  Most of the nudity is avoidable, some isn't.

There were many glitches where the  AI wouldn't  load correctly and were impossible to kill.  I had to restart from the last checkpoint, which sometimes was about 5 minutes of gameplay.  Not too bad, but annoying nonetheless. 21:9 resolution worked with no problems, and ran suprisingly well (proper scaled UI).

Pros:
Visuals
21:9 Support
Voice Acting
Soundtrack
Cons:
Linear Story
Unnecessarily Sexual
Poor AI
Poor Gun Balance
Crashes/NPC Bugs
Overall: 4/10

reviewText: A good example of a consolised corridor shooter. There's no FOV slider and the default FOV is so low it will make you sick. There's no quicksaving and if you start a different mission then the game will overwrite your previous saves. This leads to painful trial & error gameplay. Most enemies are bullet sponges, some monsters can take several mags in the face despite having no armour.  Holo sights on weapons are useless because you can barely see anything through their green glass. Completely linear gameplay. No multiplayer. Ridiculously unrealistic setting. Where does the metro even get clean air from? All the air intakes are on the surface! This is fantasy monster land, not the realistic survival shooter it claims to be.\n\nThe graphics are nice, but when you look down you can't see your legs.

reviewText:
요번 리덕스의 달라진것

-비쥬얼적인건 없다, 여전히 어드벤스드 피직스는 사양을 매우매우 요구한다
-2개의 플레이스타일 간단하게 말하면 2033원판의 플레이스타일과 라스트라이트 본 플레이스타일을 선택가능
-개선된 스텔스 AI., 근데가끔 어색하거나 어이없을때가 있다, 다만 저번처럼 옆에 전구를쏴도 애들이 반응않하는수준은아니다 플레이어가 점프할때도 알아채린다
-파벨디엘시에서만가능하던 금고열기가 본싱글에서 가능하다2033리덕스에서도 있다
-디엘시 모두포함(말그대로 모두, 심지어 라스트라이트는 100발먼저 얻고 시작하는는 디엘시조차 포함시켯다)
-PC버젼의 도전과제 수정(디엘시 도전과제 몇몇 삭제, 쉐도우레인저삭제)

-총평가
라라원판이 삭제된지금 메트로시리즈를 첨접하는거라면 갠적으로 리덕스팩을 추천해본다 게임 밝기가 밝다는 평이많다 게임내에 감마조정이있으니 플레이어 성향껏조정하고 플레이할것 달라진것중에서 서바이벌/스파르탄스타일 선택에따라 게임플레이가
상당히 달라지며 플레이어 성향마다 새로운재미를 준다, 2033원판의 플레이를 라스트라이트에서 즐길수있는것

라스트라이트 오리지널을 가진 나또한 원판이있는 유저들에겐... 뭐라할말이 없다  혹시 도전과제 난이도가 신경이쓰인다면 리덕스를 추천한다

괜찮은 차세대버젼 리마스터이며 PC버젼도 상당히 좋은비쥬얼을 보여준다

reviewText:
Why i did not like this game

1) The story is boring,predictable,recycled
2) The game is so Linear it hurts me. Go from A to B to C
3) The Dialogue/Monologue in between are unskippable
4) No choice what so ever Do the task exactly like the Dev wants you or stay. That would not be a bad thing necessary but the info we get is just not enough we need to do a trial/error thing till we get it right. Which would not be a bad thing if i was fighting a Boss or something but dying 50 times while searching for an item on a stupid map i dont even have freedom of movement on no thank you.
5)Stupid Russian accent. I would rather have them speak Russian and have english subs than hearing that stupid accent.
6)And the Number 1 Sin in a Video game confusing Challenging Gameplay with Difficulty by Limiting the Player. Meaning if you can not compose a chalenging task have the Player do something dificult. Like looking for a needel in a pile of ♥♥♥♥ Game. I don't mind losing to a Boss or running out of time in a mission as long as it is fun and challenging, i will try and complete the mission 1k times. But if its just difficult because the mechanics or physics suck or i am limited in my movement in 2015... that just tells me Devs where out of imagination ....

So people do yourself a favor and get a better game , i am not saying this is a totally bad game but most definitely there are tons of better games out there on the same price range

reviewText:
It is a rare thing when I start out loving a game and then end up hating it. At first I thought this was the best game I'd played since Half-life 2. Having played open world FPS's for the last few years, the linear scripted style was a nice and welcome change of pace, unfortunately it becomes exponentially stupidly difficult even on normal.

Survival mode. The purpose of this mode is to make ammo scarce among other things. I am accustom to beating games on hardcore so I started out in hardcore/survival AND hardcore ranger mode. The results.... I have never played a game with ammo so readily available. Its everywhere! around every corner, on every dude you kill. In every gun. Guns are everywhere too. I have never run out of ammo once. My thinking is that they somehow got survival mode and spartan mode mixed up because thats exactly the way it plays. Of course having lots of ammo didn't make it much easier because once your halfway thru the game it gets impossibly hard. Not challanging hard, stupid hard!
You will find yourself starting over just about every single scene a good 50 times minimum. I made it  75% but then had to make a excecutive decision to delete the game from my library as it was just not fun anymore. I am a hardcore FPS verteran but this was just pure BS!!!

I came back a few months later and tried to finish the game, but this time on normal survival/normal ranger mode. Slightly easier but with noticably less health kits which made no sense. But again, every area beyond halfway thru the game required around 50 to 100 replays before finally fluking your way to the next check point. reviewText:
This game is really nice, like his story. It is also a good fps, and graphisms are not so bad.
I put a negative review, because there's still some bugs. At many moments, I've got spawnkilled many times, so I had to restart the entire mission.
It was so a pain to play in this conditions that I decided to do the story in normal difficulty. So, I had enough filter, so, no problem with that, but I think that if I wouldn't have enough filter (wich is unusual in normal difficulty lol), It would has been the same (getting spawnkilled).
In conclusion, the game is pretty good, but this kind of bugs can screw everything.

reviewText:
I liked the original Metro game and when I saw this re-release version so cheap, I couldn't hold myself from buying it on a Steam sale. I mean come on, 5€? That's great!

Except it wasn't. I'm unsure what in the actual f#ck is going on with this game, but it refuses to work. Frame-rate is good, controls are fine, it's just that after the lack-luster intro of the game, the NPC that I have to go arround with refuses to move.

I restarted back from a check-point, and that NPC kept getting stuck. I started the game all over (literally 10 minutes into the game so whatever), it happens again. I DOWNLOADED THE GAME AGAIN, and yet it happens.

Well, screw it. I'm refunding it. This is all I have to say about Metro: Last Light Redux"

reviewText:
Стремный, казуальный шутер для школьников фапающих на перекачанных пафосом и несмешными шутками мужиков.

Сюжет невероятно банален и предсказуем, персонажи представляют из себя полное собрание ВСЕХ голливудских клише, ещё в начале игры становится очевидно какие отношения у ГГ будут к концу  - эта баба отдастся ему как полная ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥a, этот окажется предателем, этот вообще умрет.

Злодеи здесь отдельная тема, они просто зaсрaнцы, у них нету никакой персонализации ВООБЩЕ, они просто ведут себя как мудaки и тут больше нечего добавить. Почему они себя так ведут? На это есть какие-то причины? Нету. Они просто злые. Всё. Точка.

Ещё в игре постоянно встречается ТЯЖЕЛЫЙ МАРАЛЬНЫЙ ВЫБОР" между набиванием eбальников и перерезания горл.

reviewText:
This game plays like a glorified movie walkthrough.

The character controls are frequently disconnected from the player, & one is constantly told what to do & where to move by voices of other characters that shout at you (as though the enemy cannot hear them).

After 2 hours of play, I had no idea what I was supposed to be doing or what the game was about, never mind the story, (I assume there is one, since there's a pre-amble, but I never figured out what it was.) However I managed to muddle through the first 2 hours completing things I'll never know, since I had almost no idea what I was supposed to be doing other than 'turn left! turn off the light! open the door!' etc, randomly shooting anything that moved that I presumed was an enemy.

Very tedious indeed.

Graphics are okay.

reviewText:
GAME IS BROKEN - DO NOT BUY

Not even 20 minutes into the game (maybe 5 minutes of controlling your character) and the game crashes to desktop with no warnings or notifications or anything.

Don't be scammed by valve allowing broken software onto their market.

EDIT:  Nearly a whole year later, and that original game breaking bug is fixed, hooray!  Now we get into the meat and potatoes:  It's still a horrifyingly buggy pile of garbage, and quite frankly if you're really invested in Metro 2033's story (you would have disregarded the game given that it skews off the book within 5 mintues but I digress), just pretend this game never existed.

As for gameplay:
-Badly suffers CoD disease, wherein there's so many scripted events and cutscenes you have 0 control over despite the game easily being able to let you control it.
-Hilariously badly scripted moments.  I let the game run for half an hour while Pavel was hanging to see if it would give me mission failed.  Nope.  He's got a titanium neck, he'll never die.
-Forced romance and BOUNCING BOOBIES WITH HORRIFICLY CHEESEY JIGGLE PHYSICS!  BECAUSE WHY NOT -- like...  Why?  Why the hell would you hamfist in such pointless things? The fact that it feels like it's literally tacked on just for the sake of having in boobs is so childish it's not even funny.
-Voices: If you're not playing with the russian voices, enjoy having so much cheesey accents breaking into plain american accents at times, and at worst, speaking bloody polish instead of russian.

Overall 4/10 at least the shootbang is good when it works.  Good luck getting it to work though!  Don't bother at all if you've got the original last light.

reviewText:
I think this is one of the greatest single player experiences out there. Metro itself is already severely underrated but the redux versions are amazing since it's a significant graphics and performance upgrade. As of now, this is my favorite single player game ever made so far. The atmosphere and story are unmatched. It made me more scared to be roaming the surface of the earth in broad daylight and I actually preferred being in unlighted metro tunnels. It manages to have as much action as a call of duty game yet can be scarier than games like Amnesia due to the heavy atmosphere. Between ghosts, anomalies, and underground warfare, The setting and story are actually so good I picked up the book this game is based on just to get more of it.

next time this game is on sale,
♥♥♥♥ING BUY THIS ♥♥♥♥
